```{r setup, include=FALSE}
#Loading library and theme setting
library(haven)
library(tidyverse)
library(rvest)
library(viridis)
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE,warning = FALSE,fig.width = 8, fig.height = 6,out.width = "90%")
options(ggplot2.continuous.colour = "viridis",ggplot2.continuous.fill = "viridis")
scale_colour_discrete = scale_colour_viridis_d
scale_fill_discrete = scale_fill_viridis_d
theme_set(theme_minimal() + theme(legend.position = "bottom"))
```

## Load the dataset and check the dataset

```{r}
abuse=read_sas("abuse.sas7bdat")
summary(abuse)
```
## Data wrangling
```{r}
#First we we want to drop the NA value and only select the variable we want to include the analysis,then the outcome variable is pivoted into readable formate
  abuse_1=abuse%>%
    select(pyear,agegrp,outcome,area,BSAE,low_sae,up_sae)%>%
    filter(outcome%in% c("COCYR", "IEMMON","MRJMON","SUMMON"))%>%
    pivot_wider(names_from="outcome",values_from = "BSAE")

```
